sourceMeaningMnemonic: There is an <radical>insect</radical> on the <radical>roof</radical> in a <radical>spoon</radical>. It's there for the eating, and it's how you plan to attract a <kanji>snake</kanji> to your roof.
meaningInfo: Snakes love insects, especially when they're ready to eat on a spoon. But, snakes don't usually go on top of the roof, so that's why you have to tempt one with an insect in a spoon.
readingMnemonic: Why don't you just bring a <kanji>snake</kanji> up to the roof yourself? Because snakes are <reading>heavy</reading> (<ja>へび</ja>).
readingInfo: Especially big snakes. They're really, really hebi.
